tickets.summary: IQVIA ELAAD Plus Daily Pipeline: Process data with 1-day delay ( Day before yesterday )
tickets.description: Background:  The IQVIA ELAAD Plus daily pipeline currently processes “yesterday’s” delivery. Due to variable daily delivery arrival times (not fixed; typically ~07:00 UTC but can be later) and to avoid partial/no updates, we need to introduce a one-day delay so the daily run processes data for the day before yesterday. Change Requested:  Update the daily pipeline’s date/partition selection logic (and any downstream dependencies) so that on each run it targets D-2 (day before yesterday) instead of D-1 (yesterday). Requirements / Scope: Daily pipeline should determine the processing date as current_run_date - 2 days (UTC) and use it consistently across all source pulls/partitions and downstream tables. Ensure scheduling/triggering aligns with the one-day delay and does not conflict with the monthly pipeline schedule. Update any configuration variables, DAG parameters, backfill logic, and monitoring/alerts that reference “yesterday”. Add/update documentation to reflect the 1-day delay. Acceptance Criteria: When triggered on date D, the pipeline ingests/refreshes data for D-2 (day before yesterday), not D-1. Validation confirms the loaded partitions/tables correspond to D-2 across all relevant datasets. No partial/no-update runs occur due to late-arriving daily deliveries. Existing 45-day rolling refresh strategy remains intact; only the anchor day shifts by one day. Run logs/metrics clearly show the effective processing date.
tickets.epic_name: IQVIA ELAAD Plus : Rolling Window Data Refresh

tickets.summary: Error Handling for Status Code in Rest Endpoints
tickets.description: Malformed JSON in request body -  Getting 500 but should get 400 Send invalid JSON syntax: { query: "{ user { name }" } (missing closing brace) Missing quotes around query string Empty request body: {} Missing authentication token -  Getting 500 but should get 401 Remove Authorization header completely Request non-existent field: -  Getting 400 but should get 422 query { user { nonExistentField } } Use Wrong Method  - Directly Hitting api on /graphql then should get 404
Investigate connection reuse on application gateway. If not happening correct its implementation. Add monitoring so that exact cause can be provided to network team which can ease in debugging

tickets.summary: Add ssm_config into MMR and inventory_tier to the MMR
tickets.description:
Hi    , can you add these two fields to the MMR? ssm_config: Note from Maks: We’ve just added  ssmConfig  yesterday under impression proto across reporting,  which includes both  bidFloor  and  negotiatedBidFloor . This will allow for more effective monitoring and historical troubleshooting. That will also get exact configuration even if the DEAL is paused/changed etc. Query from Vaso:  SELECT ssm_config FROM bidder.impression WHERE date='2026-02-06' AND ssm_config IS NOT NULL  Inventory Tier: Query from Zuba: select campaign_id, inventory_tier, sum(1)
from bidder.impression where date = '2026-02-08' and inventory_tier is not null
group by 1,2
order by 1,2

tickets.epic_name: GraphQL to Rest: Phase 2 Additional requirements

tickets.summary: Update the IQVIA monthly dag to load daily data
tickets.description: Under the current loading strategy :  We insert new data for the monthly delivery from S3   We load the older data from previous version table to current version table ( before 2 years )   The daily data is being added into the previous tables  We would need to load this latest data too from previous version table to current version table   Update the Monthly dag to handle these changes  Types  :  RX  FACT  MX  FACT
tickets.epic_name: IQVIA ELAAD Plus : Rolling Window Data Refresh

tickets.summary: Generate JAN 2026 Orion Discount qualification report for Finance Team
tickets.description: Produce a report for the Finance team for January 2026 using the updated Orion ad group name qualification logic. Ensure the report accurately reflects all ad groups that qualify under the new rules and deliver it to the Finance team.
tickets.epic_name: Update Ad Group Name Qualification for JBP Orion

tickets.summary: Update MMR backfill pipeline to support new ori qualification logic for new data
tickets.description: To enhance the Orion audit log table, separate the current table to include new ORI qualification logic starting in 2026. This will streamline processes while allowing the existing table to backfill older data. Modify the MMR backfill pipeline to read from the new Orion audit log table with updated ad group name qualification logic from January 2026, while still using the existing table for data prior to 2026.
tickets.epic_name: Update Ad Group Name Qualification for JBP Orion

tickets.description: User story As a data analyst, when I receive the Creative ID Report, I want to see updated fields so that I can analyze data accurately in the correct timezones. Context We are adding additional fields to the ‘Campaign Creative Report - DeepIntent’ that STAQ sends to us. This is to ensure we capture data in the correct timezones. Requirements The report must include the following updated headers: date Advertiser ID (DI) Advertiser Name (DI) Order ID (DI) Order Name (DI) Campaign ID DI Campaign Name DI Creative ID (DI) 1P Impressions 1P Clicks 1P Video Completions 3P Impressions 3P Impressions - Advertiser 3P Clicks 3P Clicks - Advertiser 3P Video Completions Previous report headers included: date  | Advertiser ID (DI) | Advertiser Name (DI) | Order ID (DI) | Order Name (DI) | Campaign ID DI | Campaign Name DI | Creative ID (DI) | 1P Impressions | 1P Clicks | 1P Video Completions | 3P Impressions | 3P Clicks | 3P Video Completions |

tickets.summary: Add support to use default variable value in gql to rest tool
tickets.description: Add support to use default variable value in gql to rest tool.  Ability to save default value in each custom variable.  Auto use this default value when no custom value is passed via query params
tickets.epic_name: GraphQL to Rest: Phase 2 Additional requirements
